title: SQL SELECT TOP, LIMIT, FETCH FIRST ROWS ONLY, ROWNUM

content.text: SQL TOP, LIMIT, FETCH FIRST or ROWNUM Clause
The SQL SELECT TOP Clause
The SELECT TOP clause is used to specify the number of records to return.
content.html: The SELECT TOP clause is used to specify the number of records to return.

content.text: The SELECT TOP clause is useful on large tables with thousands of records. Returning a large number of records can impact performance.
content.html: The SELECT TOP clause is useful on large tables with thousands of records. Returning a large number of records can impact performance.

content.code_html: SELECT TOP 3 * FROM Customers;

content.text: Note: Not all database systems support the SELECT TOP clause. MySQL supports the LIMIT clause to select a limited number of records, while Oracle uses FETCH FIRST n ROWS ONLY and ROWNUM .
content.html: Note: Not all database systems support the SELECT TOP clause. MySQL supports the LIMIT clause to select a limited number of records, while Oracle uses FETCH FIRST n ROWS ONLY and ROWNUM.

content.text: SQL Server / MS Access Syntax:
content.html: SQL Server / MS Access Syntax:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
SELECT TOP number|percent column_name(s)
FROM table_nameWHERE condition;

content.code: SELECT TOP number | percent column_name(s) FROM table_name WHERE condition ;

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
SELECT TOP number|percent column_name(s)
FROM table_nameWHERE condition;

content.text: MySQL Syntax:
content.html: MySQL Syntax:

content.code: SELECT column_name(s) FROM table_name WHERE condition LIMIT number ;

content.text: Oracle 12 Syntax:
content.html: Oracle 12 Syntax:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
SELECT column_name(s)
FROM table_nameORDER BY 
  column_name(s)
  FETCH FIRST number ROWS ONLY;

content.code: SELECT column_name(s) FROM table_name ORDER BY column_name(s) FETCH FIRST number ROWS ONLY;

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
SELECT column_name(s)
FROM table_nameORDER BY 
  column_name(s)
  FETCH FIRST number ROWS ONLY;

content.text: Older Oracle Syntax:
content.html: Older Oracle Syntax:

content.code: SELECT column_name(s) FROM table_name WHERE ROWNUM <= number ;

content.text: Older Oracle Syntax (with ORDER BY):
content.html: Older Oracle Syntax (with ORDER BY):

content.code: SELECT * FROM ( SELECT column_name(s) FROM table_name ORDER BY column_name(s) ) WHERE ROWNUM <= number ;

content.text: Demo Database
Below is a selection from the Customers table used in the examples:
content.html: Below is a selection from the Customers table used in the examples:

content.code_html:
CustomerID CustomerName ContactName Address City PostalCode Country

content.text: LIMIT
The following SQL statement shows the equivalent example for MySQL:
content.html: The following SQL statement shows the equivalent example for MySQL:

content.code_html:
SELECT * FROM Customers
LIMIT 3;

content.text: FETCH FIRST
The following SQL statement shows the equivalent example for Oracle:
content.html: The following SQL statement shows the equivalent example for Oracle:

syntaxHighlighting.text: SELECT * FROM CustomersFETCH FIRST 3 ROWS ONLY;

content.code: SELECT * FROM CustomersFETCH FIRST 3 ROWS ONLY;

syntax_highlighting.text: SELECT * FROM CustomersFETCH FIRST 3 ROWS ONLY;

content.code_html:
SELECT * FROM Customers
FETCH FIRST 3 ROWS ONLY;

syntax_highlighting_data.text: SELECT * FROM CustomersFETCH FIRST 3 ROWS ONLY;

content.text: SQL TOP PERCENT Example
The following SQL statement selects the first 50% of the records from the "Customers" table (for SQL Server/MS Access):
content.html: The following SQL statement selects the first 50% of the records from the "Customers" table (for SQL Server/MS Access):

content.code_html: SELECT TOP 50 PERCENT * FROM Customers;

content.text: The following SQL statement shows the equivalent example for Oracle:
content.html: The following SQL statement shows the equivalent example for Oracle:

syntaxHighlighting.text: SELECT * FROM CustomersFETCH FIRST 50 PERCENT ROWS ONLY;

content.code: SELECT * FROM CustomersFETCH FIRST 50 PERCENT ROWS ONLY;

syntax_highlighting.text: SELECT * FROM CustomersFETCH FIRST 50 PERCENT ROWS ONLY;

content.code_html:
SELECT * FROM Customers
FETCH FIRST 50 PERCENT ROWS ONLY;

syntax_highlighting_data.text: SELECT * FROM CustomersFETCH FIRST 50 PERCENT ROWS ONLY;

content.text: ADD a WHERE CLAUSE
The following SQL statement selects the first three records from the "Customers" table, where the country is "Germany" (for SQL Server/MS Access):
content.html: The following SQL statement selects the first three records from the "Customers" table, where the country is "Germany" (for SQL Server/MS Access):

content.code_html:
SELECT TOP 3 * FROM Customers
WHERE Country='Germany';

content.text: The following SQL statement shows the equivalent example for MySQL:
content.html: The following SQL statement shows the equivalent example for MySQL:

content.code_html:
SELECT * FROM Customers
WHERE Country='Germany'
LIMIT 3;

content.text: The following SQL statement shows the equivalent example for Oracle:
content.html: The following SQL statement shows the equivalent example for Oracle:

syntaxHighlighting.text: SELECT * FROM CustomersWHERE Country='Germany'FETCH FIRST 3 ROWS ONLY;

content.code: SELECT * FROM CustomersWHERE Country='Germany'FETCH FIRST 3 ROWS ONLY;

syntax_highlighting.text: SELECT * FROM CustomersWHERE Country='Germany'FETCH FIRST 3 ROWS ONLY;

content.code_html:
SELECT * FROM Customers
WHERE Country='Germany'
FETCH FIRST 3 ROWS ONLY;

syntax_highlighting_data.text: SELECT * FROM CustomersWHERE Country='Germany'FETCH FIRST 3 ROWS ONLY;

content.text: ADD the ORDER BY Keyword
Add the ORDER BY keyword when you want to sort the result, and return the first 3 records of the sorted result.
content.html: Add the ORDER BY keyword when you want to sort the result, and return the first 3 records of the sorted result.

content.text: For SQL Server and MS Access:
content.html: For SQL Server and MS Access:

syntaxHighlighting.text: SELECT TOP 3 * FROM CustomersORDER BY CustomerName DESC;

content.code: SELECT TOP 3 * FROM CustomersORDER BY CustomerName DESC;

syntax_highlighting.text: SELECT TOP 3 * FROM CustomersORDER BY CustomerName DESC;

content.code_html:
SELECT TOP 3 * FROM Customers
ORDER BY CustomerName DESC;

syntax_highlighting_data.text: SELECT TOP 3 * FROM CustomersORDER BY CustomerName DESC;

content.text: The following SQL statement shows the equivalent example for MySQL:
content.html: The following SQL statement shows the equivalent example for MySQL:

syntaxHighlighting.text: SELECT * FROM CustomersORDER BY CustomerName DESCLIMIT 3;

content.code: SELECT * FROM CustomersORDER BY CustomerName DESCLIMIT 3;

syntax_highlighting.text: SELECT * FROM CustomersORDER BY CustomerName DESCLIMIT 3;

content.code_html:
SELECT * FROM Customers
ORDER BY CustomerName DESC
LIMIT 3;

syntax_highlighting_data.text: SELECT * FROM CustomersORDER BY CustomerName DESCLIMIT 3;

content.text: The following SQL statement shows the equivalent example for Oracle:
content.html: The following SQL statement shows the equivalent example for Oracle:

syntaxHighlighting.text: SELECT * FROM CustomersORDER BY CustomerName DESCFETCH FIRST 3 ROWS ONLY;

content.code: SELECT * FROM CustomersORDER BY CustomerName DESCFETCH FIRST 3 ROWS ONLY;

syntax_highlighting.text: SELECT * FROM CustomersORDER BY CustomerName DESCFETCH FIRST 3 ROWS ONLY;

content.code_html:
SELECT * FROM Customers
ORDER BY CustomerName DESC
FETCH FIRST 3 ROWS ONLY;

syntax_highlighting_data.text: SELECT * FROM CustomersORDER BY CustomerName DESCFETCH FIRST 3 ROWS ONLY;

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
What would the following query do in SQL Server? SELECT TOP 5 * FROM Customers;
content.html:
What would the following query do in SQL Server?
SELECT TOP 5 * FROM Customers;

metadata.question: What would the following query do in SQL Server?SELECT TOP 5 * FROM Customers;

options.text: Select the first 5 records from the Customers table
Select the last 5 records from the Customers table
Select all records with CustomerID less than 5
